item.title: Feeding the birds member of staff, 22nd June
item.description:
Hello I saw member of the staff from st John wood station they are feeding the birds outside the station I can't take picture of him he get angry and don't let go to the station they feeding the birds front of everyone and very dirty and smell he was white guy like European he ware in classes and uniform from the station is very dongrosr and bad for everyone I have been seeing them for long time I don't know if they trying to kill people for doing this this really dirty and missing around Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Terrace, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: The Lesnes Abbey drummers and metal bashers are back, 22nd June
item.description:
Further to FMS report ref 4714363, there is once again the problem of men congregating in the Lesnes Abbey grounds on a Sunday early evening to bang drums and bash pieces of metal. There was a group of about 8 men today at 18:00 making a noise that could be heard in nearby roads, even though they were beyond the abbey ruins and in front of the woods. Please can security patrol the park next Sunday to stop this anti-social behaviour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant large branches from overgrown tree into our backyard endangering our children, 22nd June
item.description:
The tree outside the back of our property in 15 thanet road, DA8 is turning into a major hazard for our children as large branches as constantly breaking inside our backyard and we have a 3 year old that cant play freely in our backyard especially on windy/heavy raining days. The tree also seems to be bending more and more into our plot and can damage our property. We would appreate your immediate attention as we already called last year to complain about this problem, which gets worse during this time of the year as the tree gets heavy with leaves so easier for branches to break.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
